title: 16-year-old shot during robbery in Ypsilanti, police say
content:
YPSILANTI, MI - A 16-year-old boy was being robbed when he was shot during the weekend, police say.
Police were called about 5:45 p.m. Saturday, Nov. 26 to the 900 block of W. Michigan Avenue in Ypsilanti for a report of a person shot, according to a release from the Ypsilanti Police Department.
Police determined the 16-year-old was being robbed at gunpoint by a group of people while in a vehicle when he grabbed the gun and it discharged, striking him in the leg.
Police were called about 5:45 p.m. to the 900 block of W. Michigan Ave. for a report of a person shot, according to the Ypsilanti Police Department.
The suspects fled in the vehicle while the teen sought help, but the suspects returned a short time later and sped off again, according to police. The suspects are acquaintances with the victim, police said.
The teen was treated at the scene and then hospitalized with non-life threatening injuries, police said.
Police say they have identified some leads on suspects and the incident remains under investigation.
A spokesman for the Ypsilanti Police Department could not be reached for further comment.
Those with information on this case are asked to contact Ypsilanti police Lt. Deric Gress at 734-482-9847 or Crime Stoppers at 1-800-SPEAKUP (773-2587).
